messages.message:
Hi <!subteam^SQ3KR3V17> - Capital One has a new requirement around AWS Instance Metadata V2 (https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/security/defense-in-depth-open-firewalls-reverse-proxies-ssrf-vulnerabilities-ec2-instance-metadata-service/)

This should be similar to their requirement to meet the Python 3 and double encryption standards. Itâ€™s not immediately pressing, but will come up for them in the future. Is this on our radar?

We-as-in-Instabase do not currently do anything with EC2 instances. Our containers run on top of kubernetes which (can) run on AWS EC2 instances, but the creation, maintenance, and configuration of those instances is up to our customers. We do not - as far as I can tell, after grepping around in our codebase - interact with the old IMDS interface at all. This should be a no-op for us.

@Heymian @achao @Handsome Dave IMDS is used by boto for accessing S3, SQS, and SES. IMDS is required for managing access via IAM Roles. We should check whether our boto libraries will support newer version of IMDS. Can you please review?
